other_tests.findings: Serum calcium of 6.5 mg/dl (hypocalcemia) and serum phosphate of 5.2 mg/dl (hyperphosphatemia) were observed.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After treatment, the patient remained eucalcemic with serum calcium levels of 8.4 mg/dl and 8.3 mg/dl for almost 6 months. On reexamination, serum calcium dropped to 7.8 mg/dl and serum phosphate was 4.4 mg/dl.

other_tests.findings: Mild degree of osteopenia in the proband (T-score of -0.9) and in the probandâ€™s mother (T-score of -1.35).
Serum uric acid was low at 2.6 mg/dl in the proband.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Hypouricemia was consistently observed in several measurements and was not affected by treatment.

other_tests.findings: All affected individuals and obligate carriers revealed the 3-kb deletion 220 kb upstream of exon A/B.
